rename.from: missing hostname line in config generated by "rclone authorize "
rename.to: missing hostname line in config generated on screen by "rclone authorize "

body:
If you use rclone authorize, you don't need a rclone.conf on the machine running it. You just need to authorize the cloud provider and paste the code into the headless machine.

So:

```
rclone authorize pcloud
```

and that's it.

It also says this in the rclone config process to show you:

```
y/n> N
For this to work, you will need rclone available on a machine that has
a web browser available.

For more help and alternate methods see: https://rclone.org/remote_setup/

Execute the following on the machine with the web browser (same rclone
version recommended):

	rclone authorize "pcloud"

Then paste the result below:
```

This was answered so I'm closing it out.

If you have a follow up question, please use the forums https://forum.rclone.org

hi,
I think you didn't understand well my first post.
sorry if I am not clear and thank you for your work on rclone.

when I use  rclone authorize "pcloud", the result printed on screen is incomplete !!!!
it misses the " the hostname" on the sceen ( a little oversight in the code I think ).
please try to reproduce it and you will understand.
If I pasted the config lines without "hostname" on the headless machine   ( what I have done first as told in the doc : Then paste the result below: )  , it obviously fails.

I find the solution by myself. my post is only for future users

Can you please share a screenshot or more detail as you should get:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5088712/90796124-eae85a80-e2dc-11ea-92c1-68cdc1f752f4.png)

on my desktop PC windows 10 ![rclone](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69429566/90803566-3882b880-e319-11ea-98c9-a28f7b922d69.png) on remote headless machine (NAS) rclone v1.52.3 - os/arch: linux/amd64 - go version: go1.14.7 => the generated config file is not OK : it misses the hostname so it seems the issue is not on the desktop windows PC but on the auto config onthe headless machine. it shoud be

It's not needed.

```
felix@lucidity:~$ rclone config show pcloud:
--------------------
[pcloud]
type = pcloud
token = {"access_token":"key","token_type":"bearer","expiry":"0001-01-01T00:00:00Z"}
--------------------
felix@lucidity:~$ rclone ls pcloud:
 22250443 Getting started with pCloud.pdf
  6319438 My Videos/pCloud.mp4
  1442376 My Music/Demo Audio 2.mp3
  6698872 My Music/GotJoy.mp3
 28096964 My Music/Lovely Day.wav
 11252576 My Music/Momentum.mp3
   666846 My Pictures/friends.jpg
   189628 My Pictures/happy-family.jpg
    32905 My Pictures/in-the-sky.jpg
   500130 My Pictures/lovers.jpg
   238222 My Pictures/romance.jpg
   162388 My Pictures/sweet.jpg
felix@lucidity:~$ ^C
felix@lucidity:~$
```
It uses the default API if you don't provide it.

I think I see what is going on here.

It is in the `rclone authorize` phase that we get to know which region the pcloud is in and set the hostname but this isn't transferred back in the cut and paste part.

The hostname only needs to be set for the new european region `eapi` which is probably why you don't have it @animosity22 

There will be other remotes with this problem too I think (eg sharefile).

I'm not sure how to fix this - maybe a comment in the docs for the moment. What do you think @sylvainLS ?

Assuming the person is using the European side, wouldn't they just put it in?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5088712/90815804-40326500-e2f9-11ea-993d-cfe304487327.png)

> Assuming the person is using the European side, wouldn't they just put it in?

Yes they could do. The host you are supposed to use comes back when you do the oauth.

Maybe I should just put two options in there api and eapi with a suggestion to set one if using `rclone authorize`
If there are only two options, that feels like a pretty solution to the issue.

I've change the configurator to this

```
Hostname to connect to.

This is normally set when rclone initially does the oauth connection,
however you will need to set it by hand if you are using remote config
with rclone authorize.

Enter a string value. Press Enter for the default ("api.pcloud.com").
Choose a number from below, or type in your own value
 1 / Original/US region
   \ "api.pcloud.com"
 2 / EU region
   \ "eapi.pcloud.com"
```

[v1.52.3-325-gfee8f21c-beta](https://beta.rclone.org/v1.52.3-325-gfee8f21c-beta/) on branch [master](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/master) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

I can confirm this bug still happens.
(packages from debian repositories)

headless  system : debian 11
rclone v1.53.3-DEV
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.15.9

gui system : debian testing
rclone v1.60.1-DEV
- os/version: debian trixie/sid (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.3.0-1-amd64 (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.19.8
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: none
Those are older versions and you should not use whatever is in the repo.
